Detailed Description

This class represents the classification stage of the OCR process, providing an interface to encapsulate different classification paradigms. When performing a classification, its task is to match every feature vector passed to the most probably character. When performing a training, its task is to compare the classified characters with a reference text, fixing the wrong decisions.

See also:
ClassificationAlgorithm, ClassifierStatistics, FeatureVector, Text
Todo:
Implement new paradigms of classification (neural networks, support vector machines,...).

virtual std::vector<std::string> Classifier::performClassification ( const std::vector< FeatureVector > &  featureVectors  )  [pure virtual]

Parameters:
featureVectors An array of feature vectors to classify.
Returns:
An array of std::string objects with the characters found, one character per vector element.
Postcondition:
The recognized characters become also available through the Classifier::characters() method.

Implemented in KnnClassifier.

const Text &  referenceText

Parameters:
featureVectors An array of feature vectors that matches the array of characters previously classified.
characters An array of std::string objects with sample characters to train.
referenceText A text to compare with the classification results character by character.
